name: fan production, for power supply unit, desktop computer | fan, for power supply unit, desktop computer | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/4642/documentation

This represents the production and assembly of1 unit of a fan for power supply unit (PSU) of a typical Desktop PC. It is based on a brushless rotary DC fan (12V, 0.15A). Main data about the composition and the weight are from dismantling activities of a PSU at Empa. ;[This dataset was already contained in the ecoinvent database version 2. It was not individually updated during the transfer to ecoinvent version 3. Life Cycle Impact Assessment results may still have changed, as they are affected by changes in the supply chain, i.e. in other datasets. This dataset was generated following the ecoinvent quality guidelines for version 2. It may have been subject to central changes described in the ecoinvent version 3 change report (http://www.ecoinvent.org/database/ecoinvent-version-3/reports-of-changes/), and the results of the central updates were reviewed extensively. The changes added e.g. consistent water flows and other information throughout the database. The documentation of this dataset can be found in the ecoinvent reports of version 2, which are still available via the ecoinvent website. The change report linked above covers all central changes that were made during the conversion process.]

From reception of metals and plastics at the factory gate.

This dataset includes the material inputs that build up all together a fan, used in a power supply unit of a Desktop PC. Requirements and emissions of the assembly process (energy, emissions, waste) are not included.
category: C:Manufacturing/26:Manufacture of computer, electronic and optical products/261:Manufacture of electronic components and boards/2610:Manufacture of electronic components and boards

processDocumentation.geographyDescription: Data used has no specific geographical origin (see Sampling Procedure).
processDocumentation.technologyDescription: Typical production of a fan, as used in PSU.

exchanges.description:
Each Desktop PC has a power supply unit that transforms the 220V electricity from the plug to the adequate voltage used within such a device. The main components of such a PSU are (i) the housing, (ii) a fan for cooling, (iii) the printed wiring board with all its components and a whole bunch of various cables.
EcoSpold01Location=GLO
